toolPanels.description: A list of all the panels to place in the side bar. The panels will be displayed in the provided order from top to bottom.

defaultToolPanel.description: The panel (identified by ID) to open by default. If none specified, the side bar is initially displayed closed.

hiddenByDefault.description: To hide the side bar by default, set this to true. If left undefined the side bar will be shown.

position.description: Sets the side bar position relative to the grid.

id.description: The unique ID for this panel. Used in the API and elsewhere to refer to the panel.

labelKey.description: The key used for localisation for displaying the label. The label is displayed in the tab button.

labelDefault.description: The default label if labelKey is missing or does not map to valid text through localisation.

iconKey.description: The key of the icon to be used as a graphical aid beside the label in the side bar.

toolPanel<br />toolPanelFramework<br />t.description: The tool panel component to use as the panel. The provided panels use components agColumnsToolPanel and agFiltersToolPanel. To provide your own custom panel component, you reference it by name here.

setSideBarVisible(visible).description: Show/hide the entire side bar, including any visible panel and the tab buttons.

isSideBarVisible().description: Returns true if the side bar is visible.

openToolPanel(id).description: Opens a particular tool panel. Provide the ID of the tool panel to open.

closeToolPanel().description: Closes the currently open tool panel (if any).

getOpenedToolPanel().description: Returns the ID of the currently shown tool panel if any, otherwise null.

setSideBar(config).description: Resets the side bar to the provided configuration. The parameter is the same as the sideBar grid property. The side bar is re-created from scratch with the new config.

getSideBar().description: Returns the current side bar configuration. If a shortcut was used, returns the detailed long form.'

setSideBarPosition(position).description: Sets the side bar position relative to the grid. Possible values are 'left' or 'right', where 'right' is the default option.
